title: ぼくの木
description: A touching story about a boy named Ren who cares for a cherry tree planted with his late mother, watching it grow through the seasons as he processes his grief and grows stronger.

pages.title: Spring Morning
pages.description: Ren gazes at the small cherry tree in the corner of the garden

sentences.春の朝、ぼくは庭のすみに立つ小さな桜の木を見つめていた。: On a spring morning, I gazed at the small cherry tree standing in the corner of the garden.
sentences.風がまだ冷たいのに、土の中からかすかに花のにおいがした。: Even though the wind was still cold, a faint scent of flowers came from the soil.
sentences.それは、お母さんと一緒に植えた木だった。: It was the tree I had planted together with my mother.

pages.title: Memories of Planting
pages.description: Ren remembers the day they planted the tree together

sentences.去年の春、二人で手を汚しながら植えたあの日を、ぼくはよく覚えている。: I remembered well that day last spring when we planted it together, getting our hands dirty.
sentences.「この木が大きくなったら、お花見しようね」と、お母さんは笑って言っていた。: "When this tree grows big, let's have a flower viewing party," my mother had said with a smile.
sentences.その笑顔が、ぼくの心の中でいまも光っていた。: That smile was still shining in my heart.

pages.title: A Broken Promise
pages.description: Mother passes away before the promise can be kept

sentences.けれど、その約束を待つ前に、お母さんは遠いところへ行ってしまった。: But before we could wait for that promise, my mother had gone far away.
sentences.部屋の中は静かで、桜の木も黙っているように見えた。: The room was quiet, and the cherry tree seemed to be silent too.

pages.title: Winter Grief
pages.description: Ren cannot approach the tree during winter

sentences.冬のあいだ、雪が降り積もっても、ぼくは木のそばへ行けなかった。: During winter, even when the snow piled up, I couldn't go near the tree.
sentences.見るたびに、胸の中がつんと痛くなったからだ。: Because every time I looked at it, my chest ached sharply.

pages.title: Teacher's Words
pages.description: A teacher's words about spring light a spark in Ren's heart

sentences.ある日、学校の先生が言った。: One day, the school teacher said,
sentences.「春はね、いろんなものが生まれ変わる季節なんだよ。」: "Spring is the season when all kinds of things are reborn."
sentences.その言葉が、ぼくの心の奥でぽっとあかりをともした。: Those words lit a small light deep in my heart.

pages.title: Finding Courage
pages.description: Ren musters courage to go to the garden and finds a small sprout

sentences.帰り道、ぼくは勇気を出して庭に出た。: On the way home, I mustered courage and went out to the garden.
sentences.冷たい風がふいても、どこかあたたかい匂いがした。: Even though a cold wind blew, there was a warm scent somewhere.
sentences.しゃがんで見ると、土の中から小さな芽がのぞいていた。: When I crouched down to look, a small sprout was peeking out from the soil.

pages.title: Mother's Presence
pages.description: Ren feels his mother's presence through the sprout

sentences.ぼくは指先でその芽をそっとなでた。: I gently stroked the sprout with my fingertips.
sentences.それは、春のやわらかい心臓の音みたいに、ぴくんと動いた気がした。: It felt like it twitched, like the soft heartbeat of spring.

pages.title: Daily Routine
pages.description: Watering the tree becomes Ren's daily routine

sentences.それから、毎朝水をあげるのが日課になった。: From then on, watering it every morning became my daily routine.
sentences.「おはよう」「きょうもがんばろうね」と声をかけながら。: While saying "Good morning" and "Let's do our best today."
sentences.誰かと話しているみたいで、寂しくなかった。: It was like talking to someone, and I didn't feel lonely.

pages.title: Growing Tree
pages.description: The tree grows little by little through rain and wind

sentences.雨の日も風の日も、木は少しずつ大きくなっていった。: On rainy days and windy days, the tree grew little by little.
sentences.ぼくは長靴をはいて傘をさし、木を守るように立った。: I wore rain boots and held an umbrella, standing as if to protect the tree.
sentences.水滴が葉の上で光り、まるで笑っているようだった。: Water drops sparkled on the leaves, as if they were laughing.

pages.title: Summer Visit
pages.description: In summer, Ren catches bugs with his friend Masaki

sentences.夏には、木の枝にセミがとまり、友だちのまさきと虫取りをした。: In summer, cicadas perched on the tree's branches, and I caught bugs with my friend Masaki.
sentences.「これ、れんのお母さんの木？」とまさきが聞く。: "Is this your mother's tree, Ren?" Masaki asked.
sentences.ぼくはうなずき、「うん、いまはぼくの木だよ」と答えた。: I nodded and answered, "Yeah, now it's my tree."

pages.title: Autumn Colors
pages.description: In autumn, the leaves turn red and yellow

sentences.秋になると、葉っぱが赤や黄色に染まり、風の中でくるくる踊った。: When autumn came, the leaves turned red and yellow, dancing round and round in the wind.
sentences.ぼくは一枚の葉を拾い上げて、「お母さんのスカーフみたい」と笑った。: I picked up a leaf and laughed, saying "It's like mother's scarf."
sentences.その笑顔を見て、お父さんもやさしく笑った。: Seeing that smile, my father smiled gently too.

pages.title: Second Winter
pages.description: When winter comes again, Ren is no longer afraid

sentences.冬がまた来ても、ぼくはもう怖くなかった。: Even when winter came again, I was no longer afraid.
sentences.木は葉を落としても、しっかり立っていた。: Even though the tree shed its leaves, it stood firmly.
sentences.「ぼくも負けないよ」と、ぼくは小さな声で言った。: "I won't give up either," I said in a small voice.

pages.title: Second Spring
pages.description: In the second spring, the cherry tree blooms for the first time

sentences.二年目の春、ぼくは朝早く目を覚ました。: In the second spring, I woke up early in the morning.
sentences.窓の外がふんわり明るくて、庭に出てみると――: The outside of the window was softly bright, and when I went out to the garden—
sentences.桜の木が、初めて小さな花を咲かせていた。: The cherry tree had bloomed small flowers for the first time.

pages.title: Cherry Blossoms
pages.description: The cherry blossoms remind Ren of his mother

sentences.花びらのひとつひとつが、やさしい手のひらみたいだった。: Each petal was like a gentle palm.
sentences.風にゆれるたび、お母さんの声が聞こえる気がした。: Every time they swayed in the wind, I felt like I could hear my mother's voice.

pages.title: Ren's Growth
pages.description: Ren stands under the tree and talks to his mother

sentences.ぼくは木の下に立ち、空を見上げた。: I stood under the tree and looked up at the sky.
sentences.桜の花びらがひとひら、ぼくの肩に落ちて、あたたかく光った。: A single cherry blossom petal fell on my shoulder and glowed warmly.
